SEARCH
Package org.apache.commons.chain.web.internal

Schnittstelle CheckedFunction<T,R,E extends Throwable>

Typparameter:
T - the type of the input to the function
R - the type of the result of the function
E - the type of the exception to the operation
Funktionsschnittstelle:
Dies ist eine funktionale Schnittstelle, die somit als Zuweisungsziel für einen Lambdaausdruck oder eine Methodenreferenz verwendet werden kann.
@FunctionalInterface public interface CheckedFunction<T,R,E extends Throwable>
Represents a function that accepts one argument and produces a result. With this functional interface it is possible that an exception is thrown.

This is a functional interface whose functional method is apply(Object).

Seit:
Chain 1.8

    andThen(CheckedFunction<? super R,? extends V,E> after)
    Returns a composed CheckedFunction that first applies this function to its input, and then applies the after function to the result.

    Returns a composed CheckedFunction that first applies the before function to its input, and then applies this function to the result.
    static <T, E extends Throwable>
    CheckedFunction<T,T,E>
    identity()
    Returns a function that always returns its input argument.

  • Methodendetails

    • apply

      R apply(T t) throws E
      Applies this function to the given argument.
      Parameter:
      t - the function argument
      Gibt zurück:
      the function result
      Löst aus:
      E - the possible exception

    • compose

      default <V> CheckedFunction<V,R,E> compose(CheckedFunction<? super V,? extends T,E> before)
      Returns a composed CheckedFunction that first applies the before function to its input, and then applies this function to the result. If evaluation of either function throws an exception, it is relayed to the caller of the composed function.
      Typparameter:
      V - the type of input to the before function, and to the composed function
      Parameter:
      before - the function to apply before this function is applied
      Gibt zurück:
      a composed function that first applies the before function and then applies this function
      Löst aus:
      NullPointerException - if before is null
      Siehe auch:
      • andThen(Function)

    • andThen

      default <V> CheckedFunction<T,V,E> andThen(CheckedFunction<? super R,? extends V,E> after)
      Returns a composed CheckedFunction that first applies this function to its input, and then applies the after function to the result. If evaluation of either function throws an exception, it is relayed to the caller of the composed function.
      Typparameter:
      V - the type of output of the after function, and of the composed function
      Parameter:
      after - the function to apply after this function is applied
      Gibt zurück:
      a composed function that first applies this function and then applies the after function
      Löst aus:
      NullPointerException - if after is null
      Siehe auch:
      • compose(Function)

    • identity

      static <T, E extends Throwable> CheckedFunction<T,T,E> identity()
      Returns a function that always returns its input argument.
      Typparameter:
      T - the type of the input and output objects to the function
      E - the type of the exception of the input and output objects to the function
      Gibt zurück:
      a function that always returns its input argument
